Getting started ( help index )
Step-by-step introduction:

This is a step-by-step tutorial to help you on your way using eSQLManager.

Step 1 - start the profile manager

When connecting to a database server connection detail have to be specified about the server you want to connect to. eSQLManager offers a tool, the profile manager, which allows you to store, re-use and manage connection properties in an easy way. The profile manager is automatically started when eSQLManager starts, or when no connection windows are open. The profile manager can be started manually by pressing the button below in the toolbar:



or by using the Options menu:



A screenshot of the profile manager:



Step 2 - specify the connection detail

The profile manager allows the following details to be specified:

1. Profile: the name of a connection profile, by which you can recognize it for re-use.
2. Server type: the type of database server that you want to connect to: MySQL, MS SQLServer 2000 or higher, PostgreSQL, Oracle.
3. Host: this is either the domain name or ip-address of the server that you want to connect to.
4. Username: username needed to connect to the server. Default username for MySQL: root, MS SQLServer: sa.
5. Password: password needed for authenticating the user.
6. Port: the port number of the database server. Default port numbers: MySQL: 3306, MSSQLServer: 1433, PostgreSQL: 5432 , Oracle: 1521.
7. Databases: an option where you can specify specific databases you want to connect to.
8. Auto-connect: this option is available for one profile only, the selected profile will automatically be used to connect to on startup.

Step 3 - save profile and connect

When all the necessary fields are specified the connection details can be saved to a profile for re-use by pressing the Save button. When the profile doesn`t need to be stored for re-use the Connect button can be pressed to directly connect with the connection details specified. After pressing the Connect button, the main connection window opens. When a succesful connect attemt was made to the specified database server, eSQLManager will show a list with all available databases, or only the databases specified at field 7. This list will be show on the left of the connection window, see the screenshot below:



You are now succesfully connected and ready to use eSQLManager!
